content.title: Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana - Recognition Of Prior Learning
content.department: Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship
content.beneficiary: Candidates of Indian nationality aged 18-45 years
content.details: The Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY) aims to enhance the employability of youth by providing skill training and certification through various modes of Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL).
benefits: Support for candidates through financial assistance
eligibility: Candidates must be of Indian nationality
Prior experience in the job role for which they seek certification
Possession of an Aadhaar card and Aadhaar-linked bank account
Fulfillment of other criteria as defined by the Sector Skill Councils (SSCs)
content.application_process: Candidates or Project Implementing Agencies (PIAs) must register on the online RFP portal for application.

faqs.question: How can I apply for RPL program as a Project Implementing Agency (PIA)?
faqs.answer: PIAs need to register on the online RFP portal and submit applications for approval.

faqs.question: What is the fee for registration for candidates under RPL Type 5?
faqs.answer: There is no fee for registration, assessment, and certification under RPL Type 5.

faqs.question: How is the total project cost calculated?
faqs.answer: The total project cost includes pay-outs to PIAs, SSCs, Kaushal Bima, and candidates.
